channel.title: Hacker News - English
channel.description: Hacker News articles summarized and translated to English

item.title: React vs. Backbone in 2025
item.description:
The Backbone code is brutally honest about what it's doing. People say "you need to rebuild React from scratch to really understand it," and they're right. React's abstraction layers make that much harder.

Read more

item.title: The Great SaaS Gaslight
item.description:
They spew customer satisfaction surveys at you after every interaction in an effort to show that they care. Success doesn’t necessarily translate into helping your organization succeed, just that you ‘succeed’ enough with the product. The trouble with best practices — then and now — is that they pretend that the world has stopped changing.

Read more

item.title: The Missing Semester of Your CS Education (2020)
item.description:
Staff: This class is co-taught by Anish, Jon, and Jose. We’ve also shared this class beyond MIT in the hopes that others may benefit from these resources. Have you created a translation of the course notes from this class.

Read more

item.title: Tell HN: OpenAI now requires ID verification and won't refund API credits
item.description:
Just frustrated here: I credited my OpenAI API account with credits, and then it turns out I have to go through some verification process to actually use the API, which involves disclosing personal data to some third-party vendor, which I am not prepared to do. So I asked for a refund and am told that that refunds are against their policy. Edit: Deepseek seems to be a lot cheaper than OpenAIEdit 2: seems verification is only needed for gpt-5, gpt-4o seems to work without it.

Read more
